column7: CSL has delivered biotechnology excellence for over a century. Today, with the combined expertise of CSL Behring, CSL Seqirus, and CSL Vifor, CSL's offerings are more diverse than ever to help patients and people everywhere get the treatments they need.

column7: CSL conducts a detailed sustainability materiality assessment every two years, with our most recent assessment undertaken in early 2022.

CSL develops and delivers innovative medicines that help people with severe and life-threatening conditions live their whole lives and protect the health of communities worldwide. The great thing about our company is that CSL creates value for various stakeholders in fulfilling this purpose.

column13: Limited assurance is commonly found in auditing and accounting, denoting a confidence level offered by auditors or accountants when examining financial data. Consequently, the assurance level needs to be higher. It needs to be more than a complete audit.

At the date of this report, there are nine directors on the Board, comprising seven independent non-executive directors, one non-independent non-executive director and one executive director.

column13: The governance framework refers to the structure, processes, policies, and practices that guide an organization's decision-making, accountability, and oversight. It encompasses the mechanisms through which an organization's objectives are set and achieved, manages risks, and monitors performance.

column6: Delegation of responsibility for managing impacts
column13: Robust processes refer to systems, procedures, or methods that are resilient, reliable, and effective in achieving their intended goals, even in the face of challenges, variations, or unexpected circumstances. These processes are designed to be solid and durable, delivering consistent results and withstanding environmental disruptions or changes.

column13: CSL Innovation Agenda refers to a strategic plan or framework established by CSL to promote and drive innovation within its operations or a particular industry or sector. The agenda may identify specific areas or domains where CSL aims to prioritize its innovation efforts.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column13: Being accountable for optimizing CSL's operations means ensuring that CSL's operational activities are conducted efficiently, effectively, and in alignment with organizational goals and objectives. This accountability typically falls on individuals or teams within CSL who have specific roles and responsibilities related to operational management, such as operations managers, directors, or executives.

column7: Conflicts of interest arise in situations in which a private interest (financial or otherwise) could influence an employee's judgment in handling transactions relating to CSL business. They can also occur when an employee's allegiance to a third party is reasonably regarded as competing with the interests and concerns of CSL.
column24: Location from Third Party Code of Conduct Page 3

column13: While CSL's Values serve as its directional compass, the Code of Responsible Business Practice (Code) provides a more detailed map to deliver on our promise to patients and public health by exemplifying high standards of conduct throughout the organization. CSL expects its third-party partners to comply with the applicable local laws and regulations of the countries in which they operate and to observe all of the principles set out in our Third Party Code of Conduct.

CSL has an Anti-Bribery and Anti-Corruption Policy that prohibits CSL businesses and employees from directly or indirectly offering, paying, soliciting or accepting bribes or giving or receiving personal favours, financial or other rewards or inducements in exchange for making business decisions. This prohibition applies regardless of the value of the reward or inducement. CSL policy also prohibits facilitation payments.
CSL have internal control systems to ensure financial statements comply with the applicable local laws of the countries. This system is set to prevent fraud and other improper conduct.

column6: Evaluation of the performance of the highest governance body
column13: Annual General Meeting (AGM) is a mandatory yearly gathering of shareholders or members of a company, organization, or association. During this meeting, the management team presents financial reports, operational updates, and other relevant information to the shareholders or members.

column6: Evaluation of the performance of the highest governance body
column13: CSL has adopted and follows a detailed and structured Enterprise Risk Management Framework (ERMF) to ensure risks are identified, evaluated, monitored and managed. This ERMF sets out the risk management processes, internal compliance and monitoring requirements, governance processes and structures, including roles and responsibilities for different levels of management.\t

column6: Evaluation of the performance of the highest governance body
column13: The Matrix of Risk is a structured tool or framework to assess and manage organizational risks. It involves categorizing risks based on their likelihood and potential impact, helping prioritize risk mitigation efforts and allocate resources effectively.

Standardized Remuneration Principles refer to an organization's consistent guidelines or rules governing employee compensation. These principles provide a framework for determining salaries, bonuses, benefits, and other forms of compensation fairly, transparently, and equitably across the organization.

The Remuneration Report is a document typically produced by CSL, often as part of its annual Report, that provides detailed information about the remuneration of its directors, executives, and other key personnel. This Report is intended to provide transparency to shareholders and stakeholders regarding how the company compensates its leadership team and key employees.

In competing for talent in a global market, we must have a remuneration framework that attracts and retains high-quality talent to deliver on our strategy and results. In 2024, the Board will continue to evaluate the Executive KMP remuneration framework to ensure it remains competitive with our global pharmaceutical/biotechnology peers.

The Board reviews the quality of earnings and risk management outcomes each year. This year, the Board made some adjustments to NPATA and CFO for matters not anticipated at the time of target setting, which resulted in a net adjustment downward to STI outcomes.

LTI awards that were granted to Executives before the acquisition of Vifor Pharma. These will be tested in calendar years 2023 and 2024. At the time of the grants, performance hurdle targets against ROIC and EPS growth metrics were set based on the financial projections undertaken and did not consider a material acquisition.

This Report sets out remuneration information for CSL's Key Management Personnel (KMP) which includes Non-Executive Directors (NEDs), the Executive Director and those vital senior executives who have authority and responsibility for planning, directing and controlling the activities of CSL during the financial year. The CSL KMP during the financial year ended 30 June 2023 and changes to KMP.

column13: The CSL Sustainability Strategy refers to the plan or framework established by CSL to integrate sustainability principles and practices into its business operations and decision-making processes. The strategy outlines CSL's vision for sustainability and sets specific goals and targets related to environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues.

Decarbonizing CSL's operations" refers to the strategic initiative or process undertaken by CSL to reduce or eliminate carbon emissions associated with its business activities and operations. CSL conducts a comprehensive assessment of its carbon footprint, identifying sources of greenhouse gas emissions across its operations, including direct emissions from fuel combustion and indirect emissions from purchased electricity, transportation, and supply chain activities.

Prioritizing integrating environmental considerations refers to an organization's strategic focus or emphasis on incorporating environmental factors into its decision-making processes, policies, and practices across all levels and functions. It may involve integrating ecological sustainability goals into the organization's mission statement, vision, and long-term strategic plans.
